quotes: From 2012 to 2013, Köhler served on the United Nations' High-level Panel on the Post-2015 Development Agenda
which was adopted by all UN member states in September 2015
Beginning in 2016, Köhler co-chaired, together with former UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan, a Special Panel of the African Development Bank (AfDB)
In 2017, Köhler was appointed by Secretary-General António Guterres as his new special envoy for Western Sahara
in late 2018 for a meeting in Geneva to broker a settlement over the territory
In 2019, he left his post on health grounds
Scope Foundation, Member of the Honorary Board (as of 2020)

quotes: Köhler also worked for numerous charities and non-profit organizations, and held an honorary professorship at the University of Tübingen
which was co-chaired by President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono of Indonesia, President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf of Liberia, and Prime Minister David Cameron of the United Kingdom
which was co-chaired by President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono of Indonesia, President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf of Liberia, and Prime Minister David Cameron of the United Kingdom
which was co-chaired by President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono of Indonesia, President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf of Liberia, and Prime Minister David Cameron of the United Kingdom
Within Germany, Köhler was widely regarded as one of the country's most experienced experts on Africa
Köhler took part in Namibia's 25th Independence Day festivities and represented Germany at President Ibrahim Boubacar Keïta's inauguration ceremony in Mali the same year
Köhler took part in Namibia's 25th Independence Day festivities and represented Germany at President Ibrahim Boubacar Keïta's inauguration ceremony in Mali the same year
In 2017, Köhler was appointed by Secretary-General António Guterres as his new special envoy for Western Sahara
in charge of restarting talks between Morocco and the Polisario independence movement over the disputed territory
In that capacity, Köhler invited the foreign ministers of Morocco, Algeria and Mauritania as well as the secretary general of the Polisario Front in late 2018 for a meeting in Geneva
